sourceMeaningMnemonic: You're in <radical>prison</radical>, but you can use your <radical>fingers</radical> and a <radical>spoon</radical> in the light of the <radical>sun</radical> to <kanji>display</kanji> little moving pictures on your cell wall. It's like a shadow puppet display except you can only make a few characters with your limited hand tools.
meaningInfo: Imagine displaying your two favorite characters in the shadows on your prison cell walls. This one is mister fingers and this one is missus spoon. They're best friends.
readingMnemonic: There is one thing you <kanji>display</kanji> more than anything else and it's <reading>ca</reading>ke (<ja>けい</ja>). You smush your fingers to make a cake shape and use the spoon to pretend you're eating it.
readingInfo: Imagine displaying cake on the wall. Now pretend to eat the shadow cake with your spoon. You can almost taste it. Except you can't, because this is still prison.
